item.title: QUIC Traffic, explained
item.description: In the constant race to speed up the web, Google quietly rolled out a new transport protocol in 2012â€”QUIC (Quick UDP Internet Connections). Over the years, it has evolved from an experimental feature to a backbone technology used by services like Chrome, YouTube, and Google Search. QUIC replaces the traditional TCP + TLS stack with a single protocol built directly on top of UDP. This shift gives QUIC a major performance edge.
